Statistics summarize.
Visualization reveals structure.
AI models learn patterns.
Humans must see patterns first.
â€œHow are sales values spread?â€
ans: by sales disbution chart with frequency
HOW TO READ THIS
Tall bars â†’ common values
Long tail â†’ skew
Gaps â†’ unusual behavior
Boxplot shows:
median
spread
outliers
This is how analysts justify removing outliers
â€œWhich city performs better?â€ Indore
Is one city dominating? indore
Is data size equal across cities? No
Would AI over-prioritize one region? No
Is there a trend over time?â€ yes
AI models LOVE time patterns
Trends â‰  noise
Visuals help you see seasonality & spikes
Are sales stable or spiky? Spiky
Is growth consistent? NO
Are high sales isolated events? no
ğŸ“Œ This thinking prevents bad model assumptions.
DAY 4 â€” VISUAL INSIGHTS
1. What does the sales distribution show?
- sales distribution shows sales with frequency
2. What did the boxplot reveal?
- median
3. Which city performs better and why?
- Indore as have higher sales 
4. Is there a visible trend over time?
- yes in april the sale is high
5. One risk if AI learns from this data blindly:
- Which chart was most informative?
Time based chart is more informative
Which chart could mislead if misread?
Sales disbution
Scatter plots connect features â†’ prediction.
This is where feature thinking starts.
ML models learn correlations, not meaning.
1. Which chart surprised me the most? correlations head map
2. Which feature seems most predictive? data with time
3. What business question does this data answer? sales
Better features beat better models. Always.
